channel.title: Never die here

item.title: Never die here
item.dc:creator: @tedyslilnoob tedyslilnoob
item.description:
@tedyslilnoob wrote:

Nope,i keep getting errors

Got it working, but it stays as 99 even if you not at that place so i did this:

public void inarea2() { if((absX >=3030 && absX <=3393 && absY >=3116 && absY <=3516)) currentHealth = 99; } else ******** <---- What wouldi make that so it resets? }

Cause if i make it currentHealth = 10; Everyones Hp will be 10 out of that area

Read full topic

item.title: Never die here
item.dc:creator: @dragonchain dragonchain
item.description:
@dragonchain wrote:

[quote=“tedyslilnoob, post:1, topic:155100”]What do i put in this;

public void inarea43() { if((absX >=3030 && absX <=3393 && absY >=3116 && absY <=3516)) {

So that who ever is in that zone CANT die, like there HP stops at 1
(liek rs tut island)[/quote]

Add this code to it:

playerLevel[3] = 99999999; else if((absX >=3030 && absX <=3393 && absY >=3116 && absY <=3516)) playerLevel[3] = 50

That hp shud be a fair health after, the code is somthig like that, if it doesn’t work, I just made this code up, I was just guessing, just trying my best.

Read full topic

Yes, but these days people think that adding a code would make it all work. You do need to call voids.

Ok ill try them, thanks

client.java:15: cannot find symbol symbol : variable playerHP location: class client playerHP = 99; ^ Note: Some input files use or override a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. 1 error Press any key to continue . . .

AND

client.java:15: cannot find symbol symbol : variable IsDead location: class client if(IsDead) { ^ client.java:16: cannot find symbol symbol : variable IsDead location: class client IsDead = false; ^ Note: Some input files use or override a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. 2 errors Press any key to continue . . .

item.title: Never die here
item.dc:creator: @Bombivion Bombivion
item.description:
@Bombivion wrote:

Then the void is useless because nothing is telling the void to load automatically. You firstly need to find your starting core.

//openWelcomeScreen(201, false, 3, (127 << 24)+1, misc.random(10));

Then below that add.

inarea43();

You could also try adding the void into the following case.

Case 121:

If so, it should end up looking something like.

case 121: inarea43(); // we could use this to make the char appear for other players only until // this guys loading is done. Also wait with regular player updates // until we receive this command. // println_debug("Loading finished."); break;

Read full topic

item.title: Never die here
item.dc:creator: @Mod_Adam Adam
item.description:
@Mod_Adam wrote:

Make the whole thing look like this and hopefully it’ll work:

public void inarea43() { if((absX >=3030 && absX <=3393 && absY >=3116 && absY <=3516)) { if(IsDead) { IsDead = false; NewHP = playerLevel[3]; } } }

or

public void inarea43() { if((absX >=3030 && absX <=3393 && absY >=3116 && absY <=3516)) { playerHP = 99; } }
Hope it helps.

Read full topic

item.title: Never die here
item.dc:creator: @Bombivion Bombivion
item.description:
@Bombivion wrote:

You would just add it as a normal void. Then link the void to health resistance.

Read full topic
